metadata.title: CVE-2023-52806 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ALSA:hda: Fix possible null-ptr-deref when assigning a stream While AudioDSPdrivers assign streams exclusively of HOST or LINK type, nothing blocks auser to attempt to assign a COUPLED stream. As supplied substream instancemay be a stub, what is the case when code-loading, such scenario ends withnull-ptr-deref.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52806` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-228-generic - 4.15.0-228.240
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-228-generic - 4.15.0-228.240
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-228-lowlatency - 4.15.0-228.240
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1155-kvm - 4.15.0-1155.160
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1172-aws - 4.15.0-1172.185
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1180-azure - 4.15.0-1180.195
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1165-gcp - 4.15.0-1165.182
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1134-oracle - 4.15.0-1134.145
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-228.240').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-173.191~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1155.160').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1172.185').
